thread.title: Big 30 Boys' Soccer: Enders’ hat trick helps Belfast clinch crown
thread.title_full: Big 30 Boys' Soccer: Enders’ hat trick helps Belfast clinch crown

title: Big 30 Boys' Soccer: Enders’ hat trick helps Belfast clinch crown
text:
WHITESVILLE — Adam Enders scored the hat trick for Belfast Central School, which clinched the Allegany County Division II regular season crown, with a 3-2 win over Whitesville in boys’ soccer action Tuesday. 
Enders now has 24 markers on the season. 
Kevin McCumiskey made three saves for the Bulldogs (9-5-1). 
Ethan Graves and Owen Miles scored for Whitesville (9-5) while Connor Waters made five saves. 
“We never led,” Whitesville coach Bill Horn said. “They were up 2-0 and we came back and tied it. Then Adam scored with 25 minutes to play for the winner. On that goal, my team kind of let down thinking he was offside and he got a breakaway and scored. 
“We beat them at their place, 2-1, and they both were great games. But, today, their win clinched the small-school title.” 
Friendship 2, Scio 0 
SCIO — Aleric Stewart (assist) and Jarred Wigent scored and Dean Bogart made five saves for Friendship (10-5). 
Seth Porter had seven saves for Scio (3-11-1), which endured its 10th straight loss. 
“It was a good hard-fought game,” Scio coach Dennis Karns said. “I actually thought we outplayed them most of the game. But they had some bounces go their way. 
“Still, my team is starting to get healthy and a game like this helps us get ready for the playoffs.” 
ALLEGANY CO. DIV. I 
Houghton 3, Cuba-Rushford 0 
HOUGHTON — Stapain Gatore scored a goal and assisted on the other two markers to key Houghton (2-13). 
Also scoring for the Panthers were Chibby Anyachebelu and Zebedee Ayorinde while Ade Obayomi had an assist and Kalem Degolyer made five saves. 
Evan Tucker recorded five saves for Cuba-Rushford (2-11-1). 
Fillmore 2, Andover 1 
ANDOVER — Derek Mancuso scored on a penalty kick and Teverett Covedill connected off an assist J.J. Miller as Fillmore overcame a 1-0 deficit. 
Dale Smith had eight saves for the Eagles (10-5). 
Dakota Gavin scored assisted by Hunter Greene while Dakota Whitsell made 10 saves for Andover (10-4-1). 
Genesee Valley 4, Bolivar-Richburg 1 
BOLIVAR— Tate Scott and Cooper Weinman each scored twice with Jon Morse, Chris Baker and Carter Schneider logging assists as Genesee Valley remained unbeaten (14-0-1). Goalie Vinny Biancuzzo needed no saves to log the win. 
For Bolivar-Richburg (4-11-1), Joe Gordon had an unusual game, logging six saves as the goalie, but also scoring the Wolverines’ lone goal on a penalty kick. 
NON-LEAGUE 
Christian Central 6, Archbishop Walsh 2 
OLEAN — Jose Ortiz scored both goals while Christian Churakos and Latrell Butler-Kemp each had assists and Adam Moore made 12 saves for Walsh (2-12). 
Ridgway 5, Smethport 0 
RIDGWAY, Pa. — Brandon Kinkead had the hat trick and Colby Hefright and Max Dush each scored once to power Ridgway. 
Blaine Groshek had four saves for the Hubbers (2-9). 
Port Allegany 4, Coudersport 1 
PORT ALLEGANY, Pa. — Mackenzie Elliott (assist) scored twice and Gage Caulkins (assist) and Brandon McCaslin (two assists) each had goals while Garrett Talkington made six saves as Port A improved to 9-7 and avenged a 2-1 loss at Coudy earlier this season. 
Eli Trimbur scored and Brandon Ehrensberger made two saves for Coudersport (7-4). 
DuBois 3, Bradford 2, OT 
DUBOIS, Pa. — Jared Hawkins scored twice, including the game-winner in overtime, and Brent Mazary added one marker to lift DuBois, which got five saves from keeper Taylor Rutherford. 
For Bradford (8-5), Todd Smith and Alex Kelly scored, Jared Lucas picked up an assist and Jack Kellam recorded 11 saves.
